Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

Award.AbstractNarration: The purpose of the workshop is two fold: first to deliver an invigorating<br/>educational program and second is to provide an outstanding<br/>opportunity to bring together women students from different departments,<br/>across the country (and possibly internationally), so as to foster a<br/>sense of kinship and camaraderie. And to provide access to the role<br/>models in this area by having senior and junior faculty present.<br/>Further enhancing this initial relationship with a long time mentoring<br/>program which will be organized by Anne Condon. Our long term goal is<br/>that these efforts will help widen the pipeline of women doing theory.<br/><br/>While there are groups for "Women in Computer Science" and "Women in<br/>Engineering" at both the university and national level, our objective in<br/>creating a "Women in Theory" workshop is to enable meaningful technical<br/>interactions among the participants. There will be significant overlap<br/>in research interests in this group to facilitate a technical program<br/>that is interesting to everyone.<br/><br/>List of confirmed technical speakers:<br/>Dorit Aharonov, Hebrew University, Shuchi Chawla, University of Wisconsin,<br/>Madison, Julia Chuzhoy, TTI,<br/>Irit Dinur, Weizmann Institute, Cynthia Dwork, Microsoft Research, Joan<br/>Feigenbaum, Yale,<br/>Shafi Goldwasser, MIT and Weizmann Institute, Tal Malkin, Columbia<br/>University, Eva Tardos, Cornell,<br/>Lisa Zhang, Bell-Labs<br/><br/>We will also have talks by the participating students and sessions<br/>devoted to discussions on issues that are especially relevant to<br/>female scientists such as finding a job and salary negotiations,<br/>communicating with your advisor, and work-life balance, etc.<br/>
